e.p.a..gloss: an independent federal agency established to coordinate programs aimed at reducing pollution and protecting the environment

epacris impressa.gloss: spindly upright shrub of southern Australia and Tasmania having white to rose or purple-red flowers

epacris obtusifolia.gloss: small erect shrub of Australia and Tasmania with fragrant ivory flowers

epacris purpurascens.gloss: small shrub of southern and western Australia having pinkish to rosy purple tubular flowers

epanaphora.gloss: repetition of a word or phrase at the beginning of successive clauses

eparchy.gloss: a diocese of the Eastern Orthodox Church

epaulet.gloss: adornment consisting of an ornamental cloth pad worn on the shoulder

epaulette.gloss: adornment consisting of an ornamental cloth pad worn on the shoulder

epha.gloss: an ancient Hebrew unit of dry measure equal to about a bushel

ephah.gloss: an ancient Hebrew unit of dry measure equal to about a bushel

ephedra.gloss: jointed and nearly leafless desert shrub having reduced scalelike leaves and reddish fleshy seeds

ephedraceae.gloss: ephedras: in some classifications included in the Gnetaceae

ephemerality.gloss: the property of lasting for a very short time

ephemeralness.gloss: the property of lasting for a very short time

ephemeris time.gloss: (astronomy) a measure of time defined by Earth's orbital motion

ephemeron.gloss: anything short-lived, as an insect that lives only for a day in its winged form

ephesians.gloss: a New Testament book containing the epistle from Saint Paul to the Ephesians which explains the divine plan for the world and the consummation of this in Christ

ephestia.gloss: small moths whose larvae spin silken tunnels and feed on stored food products

ephestia elutella.gloss: small moth whose larvae feed on tobacco and other dried plant products

ephesus.gloss: the third ecumenical council in 431 which declared Mary as mother of God and condemned Pelagius

ephippiorhynchus senegalensis.gloss: large black-and-white stork of tropical Africa

epi.gloss: a self-report personality inventory based on Hans Eysenck's factor analysis of personality which assumes three basic factors (the two most important being extraversion to introversion and neuroticism)

epic.gloss: constituting or having to do with or suggestive of a literary epic

epic poem.gloss: a long narrative poem telling of a hero's deeds

epic poetry.gloss: poetry celebrating the deeds of some hero

epicalyx.gloss: a group of bracts simulating a calyx as in a carnation or hibiscus

epicanthic fold.gloss: a vertical fold of skin over the nasal canthus

epicanthus.gloss: a vertical fold of skin over the nasal canthus

epicardium.gloss: the innermost of the two layers of the pericardium

epicarp.gloss: outermost layer of the pericarp of fruits as the skin of a peach or grape

epicene person.gloss: one having both male and female sexual characteristics and organs

epicenter.gloss: the point on the Earth's surface directly above the focus of an earthquake

epicentre.gloss: the point on the Earth's surface directly above the focus of an earthquake

epicure.gloss: a person devoted to refined sensuous enjoyment (especially good food and drink)

epicurean.gloss: displaying luxury and furnishing gratification to the senses

epicyclic gear.gloss: an outer gear that revolves about a central sun gear of an epicyclic train

epicyclic gear train.gloss: a system of epicyclic gears in which at least one wheel axis itself revolves about another fixed axis

epicyclic train.gloss: a system of epicyclic gears in which at least one wheel axis itself revolves about another fixed axis

epidemic cholera.gloss: an acute intestinal infection caused by ingestion of contaminated water or food

epidemic encephalitis.gloss: an encephalitis that was epidemic between 1915 and 1926

epidemic hysertia.gloss: a condition in which a large group of people exhibit the same state of violent mental agitation

epidemic meningitis.gloss: meningitis caused by bacteria and often fatal

epidemic myalgia.gloss: an acute infectious disease occurring in epidemic form and featuring paroxysms of pain (usually in the chest)

epidemic parotitis.gloss: an acute contagious viral disease characterized by fever and by swelling of the parotid glands

epidemic pleurodynia.gloss: an acute infectious disease occurring in epidemic form and featuring paroxysms of pain (usually in the chest)

epidemic roseola.gloss: a contagious viral disease that is a milder form of measles lasting three or four days

epidendrum.gloss: large and variable genus of terrestrial or epiphytic or lithophytic orchids of tropical and subtropical Americas

epidendrum tampense.gloss: orchid of Florida and the Bahamas having showy brightly colored flowers

epidendrum venosum.gloss: Mexican epiphytic orchid having pale green or yellow-green flowers with white purple-veined lip

epidermis.gloss: the outer layer of the skin covering the exterior body surface of vertebrates

epidural.gloss: on or outside the dura mater

epidural anaesthesia.gloss: regional anesthesia resulting from injection of an anesthetic into the epidural space of the spinal cord

epidural anesthesia.gloss: regional anesthesia resulting from injection of an anesthetic into the epidural space of the spinal cord

epigaea.gloss: small creeping evergreen shrubs: trailing arbutus

epigaea repens.gloss: low-growing evergreen shrub of eastern North America with leathery leaves and clusters of fragrant pink or white flowers

epigastric artery.gloss: one of three arteries supplying the anterior walls of the abdomen

epigastric fossa.gloss: a slight depression in the midline just below the sternum (where a blow can affect the solar plexus)

epigon.gloss: an inferior imitator of some distinguished writer, artist, or musician

epigone.gloss: an inferior imitator of some distinguished writer, artist, or musician

epilachna.gloss: genus of ladybugs native to Mexico and Central America

epilachna varivestis.gloss: introduced into the United States from Mexico

epilation.gloss: the act of removing hair (as from an animal skin)

epilator.gloss: a cosmetic for temporary removal of undesired hair

epilepsia major.gloss: epilepsy in which the attacks involve loss of consciousness and tonic spasms of the musculature followed by generalized jerking
a seizure during which the patient becomes unconscious and has convulsions over the entire body

epilepsia minor.gloss: epilepsy characterized by paroxysmal attacks of brief clouding of consciousness (and possibly other abnormalities)

epilobium.gloss: large widely distributed genus of herbs and subshrubs of especially western North America and Arctic areas

epilobium angustifolium.gloss: tall North American perennial with creeping rootstocks and narrow leaves and spikes of pinkish-purple flowers occurring in great abundance in burned-over areas or recent clearings

epilobium canum canum.gloss: shrublet of southwestern United States to Mexico having brilliant scarlet flowers

epilobium hirsutum.gloss: plant of Europe and Asia having purplish-red flowers and hairy stems and leaves

epilog.gloss: a short speech (often in verse) addressed directly to the audience by an actor at the end of a play

epilogue.gloss: a short speech (often in verse) addressed directly to the audience by an actor at the end of a play

epimedium.gloss: herbaceous perennials of Mediterranean to India and eastern Asia

epimedium grandiflorum.gloss: slow-growing creeping plant with semi-evergreen leaves on erect wiry stems

epinephelus fulvus.gloss: black-spotted usually dusky-colored fish with reddish fins

epinephrin.gloss: a catecholamine secreted by the adrenal medulla in response to stress (trade name Adrenalin)

epinephrine.gloss: a catecholamine secreted by the adrenal medulla in response to stress (trade name Adrenalin)

epipactis.gloss: genus of hardy orchids with leafy-bracted racemes of greenish or purplish irregular flowers

epipactis gigantea.gloss: orchid growing along streams or ponds of western North America having leafy stems and 1 greenish-brown and pinkish flower in the axil of each upper leaf

epipaleolithic.gloss: middle part of the Stone Age beginning about 15,000 years ago

epiphora.gloss: repetition of the ends of two or more successive sentences, verses, etc.

epiphyllum.gloss: any cactus of the genus Epiphyllum having flattened jointed irregularly branching stems and showy tubular flowers

epiphysis.gloss: a small endocrine gland in the brain

epiphyte.gloss: plant that derives moisture and nutrients from the air and rain

epiphytic plant.gloss: plant that derives moisture and nutrients from the air and rain

epipremnum aureum.gloss: evergreen liana widely cultivated for its variegated foliage

episcia dianthiflora.gloss: low-growing creeping perennial of Central America having deeply fringed white flowers

episcleral veins.gloss: small veins in the sclera near the corneal margin

episode.gloss: a part of a broadcast serial

episodic memory.gloss: memory for episodes in your own life

episperm.gloss: protective outer layer of seeds of flowering plants

epistasis.gloss: the suppression of a gene by the effect of an unrelated gene
